subject: Art & Design
title: Fashion and Gender: Breaking Binary Dress Codes
description: A quick win: understand Fashion and Gender: Breaking Binary Dress Codes.

hook.text: Harry Styles wore a dress on the cover of Vogue.

buildup.text: For centuries, Western fashion enforced binary dress codes: trousers for men, skirts for women. Deviation meant scandal.

discovery.text: Gender-fluid fashion rejects the binary: unisex collections, men in skirts, women in suiting. Designers challenge norms.

twist.text: Historically, gender-neutral clothing was normal. In many cultures, robes, tunics, and wraps served all genders.

climax.text: Brands like Telfar, Harris Reed, and Palomo Spain build identities around genderless design.

punchline.text: Clothes don't have a gender. People decided they should. People can undecide.
